original_title: McDonald’s Terminates Its Drive-Through Ordering AI Assistant
original_content:
McDonalds recently announced that it will be scrapping the voice-assistant which it has installed at over 100 of its drive-throughs after a two-year trial run. In the email that was sent to franchises, McDonalds did say that they are still looking at voice ordering solutions for automated order taking (AOT), but it appears that for now the test was a disappointment. Judging by the many viral videos of customers struggling to place an order through the AOT system, its not hard to see why.
This AOT attempt began when in 2019 McDonalds acquired AI company Apprente to create its McD Tech Labs, only to sell it again to IBM who then got contracted to create the technology for McDonalds fast-food joints. When launched in 2021, it was expected that McDonalds drive-through ordering lanes would eventually all be serviced by AOT, with an experience akin to the Alexa and Siri voice assistants that everyone knows and loves (to yell at).
With the demise of this test at McDonalds, it would seem that the biggest change is likely to be in the wider automation of preparing fast-food instead, with robots doing the burger flipping and freedom frying rather than a human. That said, would you prefer the McD voice assistant when going through a Drive-Thru® over a human voice?
title: マクドナルドの音声アシスタントが失敗「ドライブスルー店舗で廃止」
body: マクドナルドはドライブスルーの音声アシスタントを廃止すると発表。AOTシステムに苦戦する客のビデオが多数出回り、失敗。AI企業Apprenteを買収し、IBMに売却。自動化の進展が期待される。
